page.title: 15HADLEIGH BYPASS
page.content: The Hadleigh Bypass was designed by the Suffolk County Council as part of a programme of road improvements to relieve towns and villages of heavey traffic.It is approximately 4km long and extends from Coram Street Farm to Lady Lane on the A1071. Work began September 1982 and lasted for about 15 months.It was built by J.Breheny Contractors Ltd.of Needham Market and cost about 1.4 million pounds to build During the works 220,000 cubic metres of earth were moved and 42,000 square metres of new road surface was laid.Two large culverts had to be placed under the embankments where the road crosses the River Brett. The Hadleigh Bypass has made the town alot quieter because all the heavy vehicles are directed away from the narrow and busy High Street.
